components.description:
A mirror with an ornate gold or silver frame. The shape and style of the mirror varies from platform to platform.

Used to talk about mirrors, reflection, or self-reflection.

version.description:
Unicode 13.0 is the version of the Unicode Standard released on March 10, 2020. 55 new emoji code points were added in this release, with all 117 new emojis for 2020 (including sequences for gender and skin tone) listed under Emoji 13.0.

More about what's new in Unicode 13.0.

apple_vendor_description: Apple's mirror emoji presents a sleek, oval-shaped handheld mirror with a polished silver frame, reflecting a bright, almost ethereal light thanks to Apple's sophisticated rendering techniques. The surface of the mirror on Apple devices appears perfectly smooth and subtly curved, suggesting clarity and introspection. It's commonly employed in messages to signify self-reflection, appearance, or the act of looking at oneself, all with the characteristic elegance of Apple's design.
